TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrincipalCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal>, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal>, class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A mutable collection of objects derived from the class. This class is designed to be used for multi-valued properties that contain Principals. Manipulating the contents of this collection changes the contents of the corresponding store property, which is made permanent when <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save%2A> is called on the corresponding principal object.

Docs.param: The object for the principal to be added to the collection.
An object that specifies the format of `identityValue`
A string that identifies the principal, in the format specified by `identityType`
Docs.summary: Searches for a object that matches the parameters, and adds it to the end of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This function can throw the following exceptions:
|Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalExistsException>|The principal matching these parameters already exists in the collection.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.NoMatchingPrincipalException>|No principal matching the specified parameters was found.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MultipleMatchesException>|More than one principal matches the specified parameters.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ArgumentException>|Thrown when `identityType` is an empty string|

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The <xref:System.Array> that should be populated with objects.
The position in `array` into which the first principal object in the collection should be copied.
Docs.summary: Copies the objects from this into the specified array, starting at the specified position index in array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `array` must be one-dimensional. If it is not, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown. Further exceptions are thrown if the number of elements to copy is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of `array`, if `array` is `null`, or if `index` is less than 0.

Docs.summary: Returns the count of Principal objects in this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal> GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerator to iterate through the principals in the .
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> containing the principals in the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Conceptually, each instance of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection> has a single enumerator associated with it. Although multiple calls to <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection.System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> return distinct <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> objects, they share the same internal state.

Docs.summary: Returns false. This is not a read-only collection.
Returns false. It is up to the application to serialize access to this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Remove(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal computer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the collection, and returns if the was a member of this , and otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This function can throw the following exceptions:
|Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.|

Docs.param: An that identifies the format of `identityValue`.
Docs.summary: Finds the object specified by the given and / pair from the collection, and returns if the identified was a member of this , and otherwise (in which case the method performs no operation).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This function can throw the following exceptions:
|Exception|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.InvalidOperation>|This method was called on the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.Members> collection for a domain group, and the domain principal to be removed is a member of the group by virtue of its `primaryGroupId` attribute.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.NoMatchingPrincipalException>|No principal matching the specified parameters was found.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MultipleMatchesException>|More than one principal matches the specified parameters. In theory, this should never happen, because <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection.Add%2A> throws an exception when there is an attempt to add duplicate principals to the collection. However, it is possible that another API created the duplicate.| |<xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ArgumentException>|Thrown when `identityType` is an empty string.|

Docs.summary: Returns a synchronization object that can be used to synchronize access to this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The T:System.Array that should be populated with objects.
The position in `array` to which the first object should be copied to.
Docs.summary: Copies the objects from this into the specified array, starting at the specified position index in array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `array` must be one-dimensional. If it is not, an <xref:System.ArgumentException> is thrown. Further exceptions are thrown if the number of elements to copy is greater than the available space from `index` to the end of `array`, if `array` is `null`, or if `index` is less than 0.

Docs.summary: Returns the count of Principal objects in this collection.
Always returns . It is up to the application to synchronize access to this collection.
Returns a synchronization object that can be used to synchronize access to this collection. Returns the object itself.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Conceptually, each instance of <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection> has a single enumerator associated with it. Although multiple calls to <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalCollection.System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> return distinct <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> objects, they share the same internal state.
